author: Special Correspondent
text:
Conveying the message to avoid use of plastics, Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao on Friday distributed cloth bags to farmers at the ‘uzhavar sandhai’ in BB Kulam.

He spoke on how plastics would affect the environment and urged the farmers to avoid using plastic bags and make the shandy an eco-friendly place.

On weekdays, about 125 farmers sold their produce at the market and on weekends and holidays, 145 farmers came here. On an average, 35 to 40 tonnes of vegetables and fruits were sold at the shandy, officials said.

In other markets

Initially, 500 cloth bags would be given to farmers here and another 250 bags each to farmers in Palanganatham and Anna Nagar for a month. Later, the consumers would be told to bring their own bags from home or buy them from farmers for a nominal price.

Mahalir Thittam Project Officer Revathi, Deputy Director V. Arul Arasu appealed to the public to avoid use of plastic bags.
title: Drive against use of plastics
